meanings.definition: To make small or reduce in size.
meanings.sent1: She micrified the cake by cutting it into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent2: The machine micrified the paper into fine shreds.
meanings.sent3: The magician micrified the elephant, making it fit into a tiny box!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter micrified the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes micrified the details of the painting, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To be reduced to a very small size.
meanings.sent1: The ice cube micrified in the warm water, disappearing slowly.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old building micrified into a pile of rubble.
meanings.sent3: The giant pumpkin micrified into a tiny shriveled fruit, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of success micrified as he faced one obstacle after another.
meanings.sent5: The once grand castle micrified into a small, forgotten ruin on the hill.
